message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MS, cs.MM

The paper presents a deep learning system for classifying pulmonary nodules in chest CT scans, which falls under the computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The system uses multi-stream convolutional networks, which are a popular deep learning architecture for image classification tasks, and therefore the paper is likely to be classified under the artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category as well. The paper also discusses the advantage of processing nodules at multiple scales, which could be relevant to the medical imaging (cs.MS) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a novel approach to automatic nodule management in lung cancer screening, which could be of interest to the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
